intro: Crookea microsepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled crookea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with narrow, thread-like sepals. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
